itemDescription: British cricketer and Royal Marines officer (1880-1920)

wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-Colonel Hugh Ferguson Montgomery  (6 May 1880 – 10 December 1920) was a British first-class cricketer and Royal Marine Light Infantry officer. Montgomery was born in India and was a cousin of Field Marshal Montgomery. He died as a result of wounds he sustained in the Bloody Sunday assassination of high-ranking British intelligence officers by the Irish Republican Army in the Irish War of Independence.
